I will never get used to living in London @EveningStandard https://t.co/qlr0QXObFT
@JuliaWootton don't be silly you can't get good chips down South, it's just not possible, you should know that!
@JuliaWootton no fish & chips in sight though! :(
A bit of local bias but I'm hoping MediaCity staple @thehiphopchippy gets top plaice at the @FishnChipAwards https://t.co/CINGR6XQg4
Forget the NTAs, I'm at a much more glamorous awards do today for BBC Local Radio https://t.co/Msoyd2YrIa
@WalkerSam I am near Finsbury Park because I'm so very North London. P.S I have gin here which I distilled myself (our dream OB) x
@WalkerSam ooh let me know if you end up having any free time whilst you're down and we can drink lots of wine in a corner somewhere

Really interesting https://t.co/ed9xHLZ5oX
@Charlie_McK why can't I retweet you I want to retweet everything you say
@hm_cooops thought you were making a point about the French class system, but as you went to the 2nd best Grammar I realised it was unlikely
Great conclusion from what was a completely unrelated tweet, maybe you should consider becoming a journalist https://t.co/zqWybDPBj6
Michael Gove when asked on @bbc5live why he didn't hold Donald Trump to account - 'well I was there as a journalist'. Erm...
@iainlee @nightanddaycafe @thecastlehotel @thekoffeepot @kingssalford are all great - around the Northern Quarter is best for small venues!

@PattieButty I might need your help actually! Can you send me a number or an email? Ta!

@MarkChrisWalsh least it wasn't a curry place so I don't have to worry about not going back
@WalkerSam in Lahndan of all places - didn't know I was time travelling
Having dinner with a male friend, waitress says 'I'll give him the bill because he should have to pay'.
The 3 o'clock and 7 o'clock (off peak cut off) trains from London always bring out the worst in people.
@hm_cooops You're welcome like your first tweet really good. Hope you enjoy following me

@MarkChrisWalsh do you remember when she used to say she didn't like curry hahahahah what an idiot
@MarkChrisWalsh sometimes I wonder why I bother with her, hearing things like this make me wonder why I continue to bother
@MarkChrisWalsh it's clever that they give you the sundries before your curry, they know that's what you're in it for really
@MarkChrisWalsh how patronising to assume you would want a Bhubaneswar, there's so many wonderful curries out there
@MarkChrisWalsh I think you're rad
Really enjoyed 'The Sellout' - Paul Beatty is first US Man Booker Prize Winner https://t.co/BqhT5yVF24
Have a great last show @WalkerSam, you've taught so much about radio. Enjoy your travels you mega Soya Diva + see you when you're back. Xx

Incredible how when you're being harassed on a tram people are too embarrassed to acknowledge what's going on

@Schofe @hollywills @sophie_brougham and everything is okay again

Anybody who needs proof of the power of radio needs to listen to the last call on @iainlee - incredible.
@lukee11is I was thinking that, on my way back now might see if he's still in!
@lukee11is this makes me really sad! I love walking past his shop and seeing him work!
@iainlee understandable, but late nights are completely different - and no more early wake ups! You'll be great. X
@iainlee hey Iain, hope you're keeping well. Excited to see what happens with your new show. X
So sad about Viola Beach, saw them a couple of weeks ago and they played an amazing cover of Let's Dance, really talented
